document_data.mainbody:
Count Claylan was nobleman of Amn in the late 14 century DR.
Claylan was a pale human man who wore finery of black and green colors.
Count Claylan was a married man who spent his time seducing naive debutantes at the exclusive Mithrest inn located in the Waukeens Promenade. Lady Lasalla was one of Claylans conquests. He grew tired of the woman in a week, leaving her brokenhearted. She later felt annoyed at other debutantes who eagerly accepted the Counts advances. In the , Alicia Paalater found herself being courted by the Count and eagerly reciprocated. The young woman was enamored with the nobleman, praising his bravery after listening to the Counts tales and being impressed by his supposed influence over the Council of Six and Lord Ophal. He was planning to petition the Council to prohibit commoners from shopping at the Waukeens Promenade during the day. Alicia was invited to visit Count Claylans manor the same evening to view his collection of Sunite statuary. The nobleman insisted that her parents did not need to be distracted from their daily activities for a visit, especially since Claylans wife was away from the manor.
